pr_title: RecordFileLogger performing far too many queries against t_entities

timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: Should use constructor injection for both fields (e.g. make both private final)
timeline.author: steven-sheehy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,44 @@

+package com.hedera.mirror.importer.parser.record;
+
+import com.hedera.mirror.importer.parser.CommonParserProperties;
+import com.hedera.mirror.importer.repository.EntityIdRepository;
+
+import lombok.RequiredArgsConstructor;
+import org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean;
+import org.springframework.data.domain.PageRequest;
+import org.springframework.stereotype.Component;
+import javax.annotation.Resource;
+
+@Component
+@RequiredArgsConstructor
+public class EntityIdCacheLoader implements InitializingBean {
+    @Resource
+    EntityIdRepository entityIdRepository;

timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: Why are we creating a separate entity for the same collection? Is this really just a minimal view of Entities? If so, you can just use interface projection or class-based DTOs for this.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: Once you switch to interface projection, just move these methods into existing EntityRepository. You can't use class-level cacheconfig though, of course.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: These would be more reusable as static helper methods on EntityId: EntityId.of(accountID)
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: you want the EntityRepository and EntityTypeRepository injected into the EntityId DTO?
replies.author: mike-burrage-hedera

replies.bodyText: No, I was thinking you'd just construct the EntityId object then use that to search the repo in recordfilelogger. Reason is we need a way to normalize this concept of an EntityId that varies per type (account/file/contract/topic). But we can also do this as part of refactor.
replies.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: Are you sure this is updating the cache? With Spring AOP you generally can't call proxied methods from inside a proxied method. It doesn't exit the class and come back in so it doesn't hit the cache decorator. You can increase spring cache logging to confirm.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: would suggest adding logging before and after findAll. Would tell us how many startup seconds it costs us to warm the cache in prod.
timeline.author: apeksharma

timeline.message:
Address code review comments.

Signed-off-by: Mike Burrage <mike.burrage@hedera.com>

timeline.bodyText: q: should this be a configurable property in commonParserProperties?
timeline.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: This is used only for caching entity types currently. I don't think it's worth adding a config param
replies.author: mike-burrage-hedera

timeline.message:
Add config property hedera.mirror.importer.parser.entityIdCacheSize

Signed-off-by: Mike Burrage <mike.burrage@hedera.com>

Utilize an in-memory mapping of t_entities.id to (shard,realm,num) to speed up insert.
Transactions that create/update/delete entities still go through the repository causing blocking/serial queries during processing.

Signed-off-by: Mike Burrage <mike.burrage@hedera.com>

Make entityIdCacheSize configurable.

Signed-off-by: Mike Burrage <mike.burrage@hedera.com>

Address code review comments.

Signed-off-by: Mike Burrage <mike.burrage@hedera.com>

Log message fix.

Signed-off-by: Mike Burrage <mike.burrage@hedera.com>

Use DTO projection.

Signed-off-by: Mike Burrage <mike.burrage@hedera.com>

Add config property hedera.mirror.importer.parser.entityIdCacheSize

Signed-off-by: Mike Burrage <mike.burrage@hedera.com>

Add config property hedera.mirror.importer.parser.entityIdCacheSize

Signed-off-by: Mike Burrage <mike.burrage@hedera.com>
